data.title: CLP Group to Focus on Selective Renewable Energy Projects in China
data.description: Hong Kong-based utility company CLP Group has announced plans to be more selective with its renewable energy projects in mainland China. Bloomberg posted on X that the firm is also exploring opportunities in Taiwan and Southeast Asia. CLP's strategic shift comes amid evolving market conditions and regulatory landscapes in the region. The company aims to optimize its investments by focusing on projects that align with its long-term sustainability goals. This approach reflects CLP's commitment to enhancing its renewable energy portfolio while navigating the complexities of the energy sector in Asia.

data.title: MYX Finance to Unlock 9.72 Million Tokens in March
data.description: MYX Finance is set to unlock approximately 9.72 million tokens on March 6 at 0:00 UTC+8. According to ChainCatcher, this information comes from token unlock data provided by the Web3 asset data platform RootData. The unlocked tokens are valued at around $9.67 million.

data.title: Hong Kong Tech Stocks Rally as SenseTime and Bilibili Lead Gains
data.description: Hong Kong's technology stocks have shown continued strength, with SenseTime (00020.HK) surging over 7% and Bilibili (09626.HK) rising more than 3%. According to Jin10, other major players like Tencent Holdings (00700.HK) and Meituan (03690.HK) also experienced gains, contributing to the positive momentum in the sector.

data.title: Hong Kong to Introduce New Light Show to Boost Tourism
data.description:
Hong Kong's latest budget proposal includes several initiatives aimed at enhancing the tourism sector, such as replacing the long-standing 'Symphony of Lights' with a new light and shadow show. According to RTHK, Secretary for Culture, Sports and Tourism, Lo Suk-pui, announced at a press conference that the new show is expected to launch in the second half of this year, marking the end of the 'Symphony of Lights' after over 20 years. The government is considering organizing a farewell event for the iconic show.

Lo explained that significantly altering the 'Symphony of Lights' would require extensive discussions with participating buildings, which could be inefficient. In contrast, the new light show offers flexibility in changing its content and can be tailored to various festive occasions, such as the Mid-Autumn Festival and Halloween. The Tourism Board is exploring the possibility of hosting the show at The Peak to enhance the appeal of traditional attractions. Lo noted that the show will not be held nightly, which could increase tourist interest. Details regarding the cost will be provided by the Tourism Board at a later date.

Lo also highlighted the strong performance of Hong Kong's tourism industry last year, with nearly 50 million visitors, a 12% increase from the previous year. Non-mainland visitors rose by 15%. During the recent Mainland China Spring Festival Golden Week, approximately 1.77 million tourists visited Hong Kong, a 14% increase compared to the same period last year. It is projected that the total number of visitors to Hong Kong this year will reach 53.8 million, an 8% rise from last year.

data.title: Bitcoin Network Hashrate Sees Slight Increase Amid Mining Developments
data.description: The Bitcoin network's average hashrate experienced a modest rise of 0.89% this week, reaching 1055 EH/s. According to NS3.AI, this increase comes as U.S.-listed Bitcoin miner Abits Group successfully raised $2.1 million through a private placement. In other developments, Bitcoin miner IREN is set to be included in the MSCI USA Index, marking a significant milestone for the company. Meanwhile, Hive reported a substantial 219% increase in revenue, although it faced a net loss attributed to accelerated depreciation.

data.title: Bitcoin Considered Undervalued Amid Market Conditions
data.description: Trader MichaÃ«l Van De Poppe believes Bitcoin is currently undervalued, presenting a rare buying opportunity akin to significant past bear market lows. According to NS3.AI, Van De Poppe points to on-chain and technical data showing Bitcoin is the most oversold since 2018. He notes a consolidation phase is underway before an anticipated increase in volatility. Despite recent price declines, Van De Poppe suggests that accumulating Bitcoin at these lower levels could be advantageous for long-term investors.

data.title: AI Agent Development Predicted to Reshape Corporate Structures
data.description:
Cobo co-founder and CEO Shenyu recently commented on social media about the transformative impact of AI Agents on corporate structures. According to Odaily, Shenyu emphasized that the disruption will not target individual skills but rather the management systems centered around standard operating procedures (SOPs).

Shenyu highlighted that traditional companies rely on SOPs to standardize human processes. However, integrating AI with autonomous planning capabilities into existing workflows might lead to inefficiencies. In the future, companies may restructure processes around 'intent and boundaries,' with humans setting goals and rules, AI optimizing execution, and humans overseeing and making decisions.

As AI involvement increases, Shenyu believes departmental barriers and middle management roles may diminish, potentially leading to more efficient dynamic collaboration models within organizations.

data.title: SUI Sees Significant Institutional Access with New ETF Launch
data.description: Stacy Muur posted on X. SUI has experienced a notable week in terms of institutional access. 21Shares has introduced TSUI, a spot SUI ETF, which is now available on the New York Stock Exchange. This development marks a significant step for SUI, enhancing its visibility and accessibility to institutional investors.

data.title: Fabric Foundation: The ROBO claim portal will go live on February 27th at 17:00.
data.description: The Fabric Foundation announced that the ROBO claim portal will officially open on February 27th at 17:00 (Beijing time). Eligible users who have signed the relevant terms and conditions can complete their ROBO token claim before March 13th at 11:00 (Beijing time).

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | U.S. Aircraft Carrier 'Ford' Approaches Israeli Coast
data.description: The U.S. aircraft carrier 'Ford' is nearing the coast of Israel. According to Jin10, this development marks a significant geopolitical movement in the region. The presence of the carrier is expected to influence regional dynamics and security considerations. The deployment of the 'Ford' underscores the strategic interests of the United States in maintaining stability and supporting allies in the area. This move comes amid heightened tensions and ongoing geopolitical challenges in the region.

data.title: This week's top mining news highlights: US-listed Bitcoin mining company Abits Group raises $2.1 million through a share placement; Bitcoin mining company IREN to be included in the MSCI US Index.
data.description: Week 9 of 2026 (February 20th - February 27th): 1. According to cloverpool, the average hashrate of the Bitcoin network was 1055 EH/s, with a high of 1184 EH/s and a low of 854 EH/s, an increase of 0.89% compared to the previous week's average hashrate (1045 EH/s). 2. According to blockchain.com, the average price of Bitcoin was $68,046, with a high of $70,020 and a low of $62,534.61, a decrease of 1.9% compared to the previous week's average price ($68,046). 3. Mining news worth noting includes: (1) US-listed Bitcoin mining company Abits Group raised US$2.1 million through a rights issue; (2) Bitcoin mining company Hive saw its revenue increase by 219% year-on-year, but suffered a net loss of US$91 million due to accelerated depreciation; (3) Bitcoin mining company IREN will be included in the MSCI US Index; Data partner: NYSE-listed Bitcoin mining company Cango Inc. (CANG).

data.title: India's Economic Growth Forecast Revised Upward Amid New Framework
data.description: India's economy is projected to expand at a faster rate than earlier anticipated for this financial year, following the introduction of a new framework for calculating economic output. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the resilience of the world's most populous nation in the face of global trade disruptions. The revised growth outlook underscores India's ability to navigate challenges in the international trade environment, suggesting a robust economic performance despite external pressures.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Oman's Foreign Minister to Meet U.S. Vice President in Washington
data.description: Oman's Foreign Minister is scheduled to meet with U.S. Vice President Vance and other American officials in Washington on Friday. According to Jin10, the discussions are expected to focus on strengthening diplomatic ties and addressing regional issues. This meeting underscores the ongoing efforts to enhance cooperation between Oman and the United States, particularly in areas of mutual interest. The visit highlights the importance of diplomatic engagement in fostering international relations and addressing geopolitical challenges.

data.title: BNB Surpasses 630 USDT with a 0.51% Increase in 24 Hours
data.description: On Feb 27, 2026, 02:49 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, BNB has crossed the 630 USDT benchmark and is now trading at 630 USDT, with a narrowed 0.51% increase in 24 hours.

data.title: USDC and Circle CCTP will be launched on Morph, providing native USD settlement and standardized cross-chain transfers.
data.description: USDC and the Circle Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol (CCTP) will be listed on Morph. USDC will be issued on Morph by a regulated entity affiliated with Circle, serving as a USD-denominated settlement asset within the network and providing a more consistent USD settlement basis for payment applications. CCTP will support USDC transfers between supported blockchains via burn-and-mint. This involves burning USDC on the source chain and natively minting it on the target chain, maintaining 1:1 supply consistency and standardized settlement behavior. Applications can choose between Standard Transfer or Fast Transfer modes as needed. Morph states that USDC and CCTP will support USD settlement and cross-chain fund transfers in scenarios such as crypto cards, cross-border remittances, payment gateways, and DeFi and trading, and will advance its payment settlement layer positioning in conjunction with Morph's $150 million Payment Accelerator program.

data.title: Hong Kong to Introduce Tax Concessions for Cryptocurrencies and Precious Metals
data.description: Hong Kong's Financial Secretary, Paul Chan, has announced plans to implement tax concessions for cryptocurrencies, precious metals, and certain commodities. According to NS3.AI, this initiative aims to attract family offices and investment funds to the region. Currently, Hong Kong hosts over 3,300 single-family offices. An amendment bill to formalize these tax incentives is expected to be introduced in early 2024, with the new tax measures set to take effect from the 2025-26 tax year.

data.title: A whale used 3x leverage to go long on 1000 BTC, worth $67.39 million.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, the whale "pension-usdt.eth" has opened a new 3x long position in BTC, holding 1,000 BTC worth $67.39 million, and currently has a floating profit of over $500,000.

data.title: South Korea's Virtual Asset Committee to Discuss Digital Asset Legislation
data.description: South Korea's Financial Services Commission is set to convene the first Virtual Asset Committee meeting of the year on March 4. According to NS3.AI, the meeting will center on the government's proposed digital asset legislation, which includes potential restrictions on major shareholders in cryptocurrency exchanges and a stablecoin issuance framework primarily managed by banks. Input from private sector committee members will be instrumental in shaping the final draft of the legislation.

data.title: Shenyu: AI will reshape corporate organizational structures, and traditional SOP models will face restructuring.
data.description: Shenyu, co-founder and CEO of Cobo, stated on social media that the development of AI agents will have a profound impact on corporate organizational structures. Its disruptive effect is not on individual skills, but rather on the long-standing management system centered on Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). He pointed out that traditional enterprises regulate human execution processes by continuously adding SOPs, while simply embedding AI with autonomous planning capabilities into existing processes may lead to inefficiency. In the future, enterprises may restructure processes around "intent and boundaries," with humans setting goals and rules, AI autonomously optimizing execution, and humans taking on supervisory and decision-making roles. Shenyu believes that as AI participation increases, departmental barriers and middle-level supervisory functions may weaken, and organizational structures are expected to evolve towards a more efficient and dynamic collaborative model.

data.title: Philippine Peso Experiences Strong Start to the Year
data.description: The Philippine peso is experiencing its most robust start to the year since 2012, driven by foreign investments in the stock market and a declining US dollar. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the positive momentum for the currency. The influx of foreign capital into the Philippine stock market has significantly contributed to the peso's appreciation. Additionally, the weakening of the US dollar has further supported the peso's strength. This combination of factors has positioned the peso for a promising beginning to the year, marking a notable performance in the currency markets.
